intro: Gongronema hemsleyanum, commonly known as the African nettle, is a member of the Urticaceae family and is native to tropical Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often hairy and have a serrated margin. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and its roots are sometimes used in traditional medicine. Gongronema hemsleyanum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and ethnobotanical research.
